titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the M*A*S*H (television program) Scripts Collection
titlestmt.author: compiled by William E. Brown, Jr. and Robert Richards

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 8, 2019 at 08:37

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The collection consists of scripts written for the television program "M*A*S*H". These scripts are the final draft copies used by Loretta Swit Holahan, who portrayed the character Margaret "Hot Lips" Houlihan for the entire run of the television series.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: MASH (Television program) Scripts Collection (MS 1404). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The "M*A*S*H" television program appeared on the CBS television network from 1971-1982. The program portrayed the daily activities of doctors and nurses serving in a Mobile Army Surgical Hospital (M*A*S*H) unit during the Korean War.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in chronological order, by the copyright date which appears on the title page of each document.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of the final versions of scripts used by Loretta Swit Holohan, in her role as Margaret "Hot Lips" Houlihan, on the television show "M*A*S*H." The collection contains scripts for all of the programs, including the pilot episode broadcast in 1971 and the final episode shown in 1982.

A small portion of the scripts contains annotations for last-minute changes in the dialogue. The scripts also contain stage directions for clothing, settings, and background views. The scripts are arranged in chronological order, by the copyright date which appears on the title page of each document.
The collection was donated to Yale University by Loretta Swit Holohan in 1985.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

did.unittitle: Follies of the Living--Concerns of the Dead
"Where There's a Will, There's a War"
